website_summaries.verdict: A quality food that both you and your dog will love.
pros: Nutrish dog food is available in 3 meaty flavors
These dry kibbles are gentle on stomachs and help to reduce gas
Tasty recipe appeals to even the pickiest dogs
cons: Kibble has an overpowering scent to some

customer_reviews.title: Pesticides????
customer_reviews.text: Just saw their is a large lawsuit that Rachael Ray’s dog food contains an ingredient found in Round Up weed killer. Threw ours away. Buying Nutro for now on.
customer_reviews.author: Beaglebuster

customer_reviews.title: Check your food for mold!
customer_reviews.text: I am normally extremely happy with this product. My dog has been eating this food for years but this time when I went to pour food into the food container I found that half of the food was moldy. Because of that I had to throw the entire bag of food away. Unfortunately because I buy such a large bag I could not return it because it is after the return cut off date.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly oshea

customer_reviews.title: Moldy pieces scattered throughout the whole 40 lb bag
customer_reviews.text: I'd been feeding this to my dog for the last couple of months and she loved it. I just ordered our probably 3rd bag, and when I went to pour it in her bowl I noticed something looked off. The food was a bit bigger than the pervious bag we had and there were several of the larger pieces that had mold all over it. I'm not sure how that happens when you have a sealed bag of dog food, but I can't in good conscious feed this to my dog ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Herberg

customer_reviews.title: Dog Became Very Sick
customer_reviews.text: My dog became so sick after eating this food ~ I'll never buy from Rachel Ray again...she doesn't even own the company anymore and sold it to Smucker's. There are so many dogs and cats getting sick on this food. Buyer beware...
customer_reviews.author: Katie Tate

customer_reviews.title: This do food almost killed my lab
customer_reviews.text: This do food almost killed my lab, not sure what is in it, but he went from healthy to bones in a month, I switched to taste of the wild and he is much better looking, but not back to what he was before this terrible dog food
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: MOLD AT THE MIDDLE OF THE BAG
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I've ordered dog food from Amazon that has made this boy sick. I don't know if it just sits around the warehouse for month, subject to humidity or poor sealing, but Hugo is a mastiff and he was suffering from GI issues, big time. I live in an apartment so running him downstairs every half hour so he can purge himself of this moldy food has not been a treat. A few times he didn't make it downstairs (Goodbye $600 security deposit!) No more dog food from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Yours Truly

customer_reviews.title: Research your dog food!
customer_reviews.text: Like others I thought this was a budget friendly option for "natural" food. After feeding my dog (now 2) this food for a year and half, my dog was hospitalized for poisoning which appears to lead back to this food. I did research and found out the chemicals in this food were slowly poisoning my dog until she got pancreatitis. Do your research on dog food, I wish I had done more of it.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Good Food!
customer_reviews.text: I've been feeding all my pups RR chicken (and the beef) for years. And, they've continued to thoroughly enjoy it. No digestive or toilet issues at this house. In fact they don't even have bad breath! They have the softest coats , and I get the sweetest kisses in Texas. And yes, once in a while I do catch the cats snacking...one tommy ginger is up to 17 pounds, and no, he is not fat from eating RR!!! He's just another very big sweet softy with fresh breath!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Made Dog Sick
customer_reviews.text: I've been feeding my Labrador Retriever various brands of chicken and vegetable based dog food from Amazon and Petco over the last year. This one made her have a severe allergic reaction. This morning after breakfast her face and eyes began swelling so I took her to the vet. She was immediately given steroids and benadryl. Around noon she broke out in hives. She had diarrhea this afternoon. She still has swelling, and they are giving her more shots. She is staying the night to be monitored. She's never had a reaction before eating this dog food.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Moore

customer_reviews.title: Healthy & Affordable
customer_reviews.text: I’m trying this brand out to save some money, but still maintain high quality for my German Shepherd. I have to say my dog adjusted quite well to the change from Taste of the Wild and Fromm. I love those brands but I can’t afford to continue at present due to financial issues. So far, I’m pleased with this food, my dog loves it, and has had no problems at all so I will most likely stick with it permanently. I recommend if you’re looking for a healthy option that’s not quite as expensive as some of the other top brands.
customer_reviews.author: Shanachie

customer_reviews.title: Healthy budget food!
customer_reviews.text: Hesitant after reading some reviews, I decided to try it out- the ingredients seemed quite good. My little​guy loves it! He's a 9 month long hair GSD. He's been eating it for about 3 months and I hope the "No Grain" dog food by Rachel Ray will be available in the 40lb bag, so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: ZTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not buying again
customer_reviews.text: If you had asked me a month ago, I would have given at least 4 stars. My dog was always eager to eat this food. I've had the dog food on subscribe and save for at least a year. This time, the food feels dryer, smells a little different, and my dog is just not interested. My dog is 95 lbs. She doesn't turn away from food often. She's practically attacking me for treats and my food, but leaves her bowl sitting.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara L. Renner

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT purchase this food through Amazon!!!! My dogs have always eaten this brand/flavor. The bag I purchased through here made both of my dogs seriously sick!!!!!!! A week and a half of throwing up along with diarrhea and stained floors is not worth it! One of my dogs has lost SO much weight from how sick this food made him.
customer_reviews.author: snn

customer_reviews.title: Skip it
customer_reviews.text: I was buying this for my dog thinking I was buying her higher quality food. Went to the vet and found out this is the "McDonald's" of dog food. So the vet recommended me The Science Diet (you can get it at any pet store) and my dog likes it and is supposedly a lot better for her and just a couple dollars more.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian M.

customer_reviews.title: Gas and bloating
customer_reviews.text: After reading articles about how "grain free" wasn't good for dogs, I decided to try new "healthy" food. The price was right too. Even after introducing the Nutrish food very slowly into my dogs' usual food, it caused bloating and gas. I thought the gas would stop after their systems got used to the new food. After a few weeks one of my dogs started to pick at his food and not finish. After a month I gave up and switched back to Purinia Beyond Grain Free and the gas stopped immediately. They haven't had any stomach issues since and my dogs are back to looking forward to meal times.
customer_reviews.author: Katie K

customer_reviews.title: Better stools and approved by our picky eater.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this food, Rachel Ray's Nutrish in general. Our picky eater doesn't turn up his nose to this food, and our other dog we have noticed a big difference in the consistency of her stools. We have tried to go cheap, which leads to loose stools and allergies, and would end up in the poor house trying to afford the top of the line foods out there when we can't really tell a difference when we feed them that anyway, so we stick with this, rotating between beef and chicken. I attached video of our Beagle, Ruby, eating her dinner.
customer_reviews.author: Vikingsfreak

customer_reviews.title: Contaminated
customer_reviews.text: This is my bichons regular dog food. With the pandemic I decided to order a large bag on Amazon verses going to the grocery. From the 1st feeding this made my dog extremely sick! We literally thought she was dying! I stopped feeding and gave her rice and boiled burger for a day and she got better. Think it MAY not be the food, I tried this food again the next day and she was sick all over again! This bag is contaminated and I WILL never order dog food via Amazon again!
customer_reviews.author: Clt

customer_reviews.title: Gives my pup uncontrollable bowel movements
customer_reviews.text: Given the name, I thought that this would be a good quality dog food that my pup could enjoy for years to come. However, as soon as I started getting her acclimated to this food, she started having uncontrollable bowel movements. Not exactly diarrhea consistency but much softer than normal and more often. It is almost like this food is a diuretic for her because within 5 minutes of eating, she poops everywhere. That's not normal. Because of how horrendous the messes have been and how she reacts to this food, we will be discontinuing it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: APRIL

customer_reviews.title: Vet said to stop using immediately.
customer_reviews.text: We recently switched our dog’s food to Rachel Ray figuring she’d probably put out a great product. I was shocked, disappointed and upset when our vet informed us that this food can cause cardiovascular issues with dogs. She told me to stop using it immediately. So now I will have to throw out over 30 lbs of food but it’s not worth risking my dog’s health. This food needs to be recalled if it can harm our pets.
customer_reviews.author: aasuhar

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sure this food led to my dog's death
customer_reviews.text: We had to switch brands of dog food that was a very healthy food and free of any preservatives or pesticides. I saw that it had Rachel Ray's name on it and it was a natural product. I should have done more research. Looking back, I should have seen that our dog started getting sick after switching right away and went down hill ever since. Throwing up, diarrhea, and more continued. She kept trying to get different food, but I thought she was just begging for table food. After doing more research, I saw that it was full of pesticides and horrible ingredients. Rachel Ray should be ashamed that her name is on it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Marek

customer_reviews.title: Ignore the reviews this is crap! Diareaha!
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Causes diarrhea! My poor dogs have been sick for weeks! We want our money back!
customer_reviews.author: Cecelia

customer_reviews.title: I thought I was buying the best
customer_reviews.text: 2 days after eating this product my dog got deadly sick he started throwing up blood and having bloody diarrhea and had to be admitted to the animal hospital. He was on his deathbed. The first question the doctor asked me was did I change his food. He was diagnosed with acute hemorrhagic diarrhea syndrome had I not had the money my to pay for an overnight stay because that's what it took to save his life my dog would be dead today.. I would rather miss a house payment then to miss my dog forever💔
customer_reviews.author: VassarV

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Our dog has an iron stomach however this gave him massive diarrhea even though we integrated it slowly.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Read an article that pretty much said you wouldn't eat fast food every day ...
customer_reviews.text: Read an article that pretty much said you wouldn't eat fast food every day every meal and expect to be heathly. Why would we our dogs? And it makes sense. I've had my boy eating Racheal Days Rays for the past 3 months. At first when looking for heathly dog food I was afraid I would not be able to budget it until I came across almost exactly what ingredients and a good price. Worth the extra few bucks to keep my boy around a little longer. I know in the long run I'll be glad I made the swap.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Dog developed hives after eating for a month and half
customer_reviews.text: I have a 95 pound pit bull and they are known to have skin issues. However, I recently switched to this brand (because it's much cheaper) and he started itching more than usual. I figured it was something to do with the grass. I started rinsing him off when coming inside. The witches turned to chewing until he would bleed. The spots only got worse until now he has hives all over his body. The Vet told us hes having an allergic reaction. Sure, he could be allergic to a common ingredient used in this brand. Buttttt we have not had this issue with any other brands. So take it for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: made my dogs sick and very thirsty. Threw it out.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth brown

customer_reviews.title: Dog would gives thumbs up, if she had oposable thumbs.
customer_reviews.text: It feels deceptive to rate this "I love it" as it is dog food and I will not be trying for the sake of this review. HOWEVER, my dog (a 1.5 year 40 lb Pit/Lab Mix) does love it. We transitioned her over from Dog Chow in an effort to find a happy medium between "Mainly made of fillers dog food" and "Made of duck more expensive than you would feed yourself dog food". We considered going grain free but after doing research learned that is really only for dogs with food allergies. Thanks Rachel Ray.
customer_reviews.author: VanessaF

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it, but he is a chocolate lab
customer_reviews.text: I would give this a foir star if I did not enrich it with a Rachel Ray grain free kibble, but the two together are great. Chewbacca’s kibble is enhanced with a noon cow ear, and a mid-afternoon apple. We add a tsp of Galilee Green olive oil daily to his kibble. His coat glistens and he has plenty of energy. His favorite exercise is “running like a freight train.” We don’t know he acquired that, takes off like a bolt of lightning any time some tells him to do it, and he will carry on faster than freight for fifteen or twenty minutes, so the food must be healthy.
customer_reviews.author: Skylark PoemsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend. He has never had poops from any dry ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog won't eat much of this. He has had major gas and diarrhea ever since we started this. I do not recommend. He has never had poops from any dry or wet dog food before.
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: My dog drank so much water with this food, ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog drank so much water with this food, must be loaded with salt. Plus, it smells gross. Won't buy it again, tossed half the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love this food
customer_reviews.text: I bought this food after a recommendation from a family member. I have 3 dogs and they absolutely love it. I have seen that there are some worries that this brand has reported health problems that people have seen in their dogs, but it seems like the lists of dogs foods that could/are causing problems is quite large. I do not know what to do when most brands have been reported to cause problems, but I have to feed my dogs something! In the end, they like it and we have not seen any issues in our 3 dogs. I would recommend it based on my experience with this brand thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: ... JUST 6 food by Rachael Ray is a much better dog food and not too expensive in comparison
customer_reviews.text: The JUST 6 food by Rachael Ray is a much better dog food and not too expensive in comparison. My 15-year old golden was eating this Nutrish for a few months and his stool was always mushy, hard to clean up. Once we switched to JUST 6 it went to a darker and normal stool, much easier to clean up. Sorry for the TMI details but it's true and probably one of the best indicators of the food quality.
customer_reviews.author: THELarus

customer_reviews.title: Loved by dogs,  good value
customer_reviews.text: My older rescue, a Dalmatian, was fed this by her original owner and they gave me the remainder. Her original parents brought her from Thailand at a cost of $50 for her airfare. They moved back to Thailand after being here 6 years and couldn't take her (probably the cost as they always want pictures), so I'm not sure you'd call her a rescue, but. My newest addition, a one year old abandoned Yorkie is being fed the same thing and he's happy. I know it is important to keep things the same as dogs have sensitive stomachs
customer_reviews.author: Sallye Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Price is Good and the Dogs LOVE it.
customer_reviews.text: I feel pretty confident with this Dog Food. Rachel Ray is definitely a trusted brand in this house. I researched the ratting online for this particular brand and flavor and it ratted pretty well. I'm sure there are better (more healthier) options out there but at a more expensive price and my dogs don't always like the taste. I've been told its bad to continuously switch dog food brands as it can upset their stomach. Now that we've landed on this and mutually seem to be satisfied with it. We will stick with Rachel Ray's Nutrish Dog Food.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Webb

customer_reviews.title: New food going well for 2 dogs
customer_reviews.text: I've recently adopted a dog and we're working to switch our current and new dog off their current foods, to this one. So far both have enjoyed the new food without issue. We're really picky about dog food and did quite a bit of research before picking this one. We've noticed a healthier and shinier coat in our new rescue since adding this to her diet (currently 1/2).
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: My dogs loves it
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about buying this product with the headlines but I did my research and realized they were not talking about this particular product so my dogs love it every time I say let’s go eat they’re running for their bowels so I’m so glad that I switched their coat are nice, soft and shiny my pug has allergies. They were really bothering her and they don’t bother her at all since I’ve switched to this product very thankful
customer_reviews.author: kerin kraaft

customer_reviews.title: Our dog really like it because she finishes it in one sitting
customer_reviews.text: Our dog really like it because she finishes it in one sitting, something she doesn't usually do. Buy then she started having accidents in the house and her anal gland seems to be overproductive! It has a stinky smell to it and she frequently excretes it when we started her on Rachel Ray's Nurish Natural Dog food! Wish I can return it! Looking for a new dog food!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonlover

customer_reviews.title: Not a fresh/real product
customer_reviews.text: I had a subscription for over a year. My dog liked it. Then the last 40 pounds bag was tainted? My dog try to eat it at first, he got different poops, in texture and color. After that he absolutely refuse to it the food. I tried to MD it with eggs, he will only like the eggs, I mixed it with wet food, he will only try to eat the wet food. I have to trash the bag, almost full. I cancel my subscription and will from now on buy at the grocery store. There was something wrong with the food for sure. Dog eats anything, but not not this.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Dogs Love It
customer_reviews.text: I have two large dogs....or rather one large and one extra large. :) Our Great Pyrenees isn't picky. He's happy with this food and just about anything else I give him. My Black Lab, however, is super picky. We usually mix it with some canned food and it's the canned stuff that would cause her to turn her nose up at it. I've seen her eat this dog food dry on occasion. So it must be good. I've tried the beef flavor as well, with the same response. My dogs love it.
customer_reviews.author: Consulting Writer

customer_reviews.title: Ants all over package
customer_reviews.text: This wasn't about the ingredients itself. My order was left on the porch in the hot sun, and it was completely covered in ants. So much so i had to toss out the food. Inside the box, on the dog food itself. And i don't know if they had found the tiniest opening, but they were inside the food as well. Extremely disappointed, and wasted money. It should have been handled differently.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya K

customer_reviews.title: Bought especially for a foster puppy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this especiallyfor a foster puppy because the previous owner said that was what he ate. So far I haven't seen him eat any of it but one of my dogs seems to like it. It arrived in a plastic sealed shipping bag. The paper sack that the food comes in was open and the food spilled out into the plastic shipping bag. The paper bag appears to have opened at the top. Doesn't really matter because I usually put it in a plastic container or zip lock bags. I guess as long as at least one of the 3 picky small dogs will eat it it is ok.
customer_reviews.author: Ladybaycrab

customer_reviews.title: Read the ingrediants before you fall for this product
customer_reviews.text: None of the dogs did very well on this food, 2 wouldn't eat it, and the third dog got terrible diarrhea, I threw the whole bag away after 2 days! I was told that Rachel Ray was putting out a good pet product, crap once I read all the crap ingredients and let's face it all her products are expensive
customer_reviews.author: rommasmomma

customer_reviews.title: The only food my picky eater will eat
customer_reviews.text: My pitbull is an extremely picky eater and I used to have to add things such as cheese or chicken broth to his food in order for him to eat. That is until I tried this food. Once we started him on this food, we no longer had to entice him to eat. Definitely a time and money saver not having to add something to his twice daily meals. Since then, we have consistently given him this food and he gobbles it up every meal time.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn B

customer_reviews.title: Do not BUY! Made both of my dogs deathly ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not BUY! Made both of my dogs deathly ill. I am praying my little guy will recover! Throwing up and very sick! Please read the reviews online! I didn’t and may pay with the death of my belived Monchie
customer_reviews.author: kim ann ressa

customer_reviews.title: love the price but dog doesn't love the food
customer_reviews.text: love the price but dog doesn't love the food. Dog has always had grain free food & has always chowed down on all brands, since I purchased this one (cost-effective w Subscribe & Save) first time, dog didn't chow down, I have to mix w other brand of grain free just so we can finish this gigantic bag.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Yum.
customer_reviews.text: Its a hit already and it was just delivered! Penny even helped open the box. I usually make my own dog food and this recipe is the closest to what I make. The pieces are small, which is good for my pup.
customer_reviews.author: Penny

customer_reviews.title: LOOVVEE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs LOVE this food! We have tried and tried and tried multiple brands of dog food. Some made our dogs sick, some made them super lazy, they were even repulsed by some. We had a couple foods that one dog would like but the other wouldn’t. But they both love Rachel Ray’s foods. This flavor has the best feedback from watching the dogs reaction. (I obviously don’t know what it taste like myself) We’ve been pretty consistent in buying it to make sure but now we have it on auto deliver, and it’s amazing! Dog food is one less thing we worry about now!
customer_reviews.author: mandy

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love this product!
customer_reviews.text: I have two dogs, a corgi/golden retriever mix and a black lab. The black lab has a sensitive stomach and this is one of the only foods that she's able to eat without any long term problems. They love it - when it's time to eat, they're sitting right next to the container with the food waiting for me to fill their bowls.
customer_reviews.author: B. Spagnola

customer_reviews.title: Causing incontinence??
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if this food is the culprit, but ever since I have been giving it to my dog, she has been drinking ALOT of water and has been leaking urine on the floor. It's the only food she has gobbled up without wet food on top, but I am wondering why the sudden change in bathroom behavior. I'm going to change to something else and see if she gets better.
customer_reviews.author: iReview

customer_reviews.title: Bad reaction to food
customer_reviews.text: I have four healthy dogs that have no fleas and only one has allergies. I thought I would treat them by buying this because it had Rachel Rays name on it. One of my dogs eats a special diet because of her allergies and was not fed this food. She is fine. The other three dogs were fed this food and are miserable and scratching like crazy! Two of the dogs fed this developed hot spots on their backs. Do not buy this food for the sake of your dogs!
customer_reviews.author: Work

customer_reviews.title: Sick dog
customer_reviews.text: If I could give zero stars I would. I regrets buying this in bulk. We bought the chicken before and had no issues. Next bag was beef and my dog started vomiting, urinating himself now constant diarrhea. It stopped for awhile and we thought maybe it wasn’t the food but it has to be this food. We stopped feeding our dog this brand and he’s so much better. So upset that this food poisoned my dog. Please research the food. Don’t buy it because of the celebrity endorsing it, not worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Healthy dog food at a healthy price!
customer_reviews.text: My babies mean the world to me. I have an old, blind English Bulldog, Olive and a sweet, full of energy, Soft Coated Wheaton Terrier, Chloe. As all of us dog prople, we want our kids to grow up healthy and filled with love & joy. Well, Ms Ray, your chicken recipe for this dog food is remarkable. My girls are happy & healthy. That makes me a proud and well rested Mom. As was said in the 70's...? GOOD STUFF MAYNARD!
customer_reviews.author: HB Mom

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves Rachel Ray!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves it. It does have some grains, but corn is not first or second ingredient. Meat is first. Right now I'm mixing it with Diamond skin & coat, grain free, because I had half bag left. Maybe I will change over completely. I'll see how this goes for the first month or 2. But, she likes it mixed. I just wanted some grains, but I wish there wasn't any corn. Corn has no nutritional value at all. Just makes more doggie do, do.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: they love Rachel Ray
customer_reviews.text: she never lets me down, I keep reading about no filler feed , so I keep trying new stuff and end up going back to Rachael Ray, and my dogs coat and health suffer every time... Every single time... I switch from Rachel Ray my dog loses her hair (Shar-pei) now I mix all meat Rachael Ray with Rachael with veggies for the extra protein but I won't be switching brands ever again , no allergens and they eat it so why listen to the hype , if its not broke don't fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Kitena Suttles

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs with acid reflux
customer_reviews.text: We had all three dogs on a different food and one developed acid reflux so we switched that dog to this food for the higher carb lower protein and it has worked great in conjunction with Prilosec! I love this food for the price and it keeps his coat soft! I would switch all my dogs to this but my other two are seniors and this brand doesn’t have a designated senior food. If they did I would make the switch because it’s nearly half he cost of the other food! VERY HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!
customer_reviews.author: Original Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Seems like good dog food however I noticed my dogs been ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems like good dog food however I noticed my dogs been a little less active since switching to this type and her stools are not as firm. Excuse me for being more descriptive than I like to be however if that is an issue you may want to work your dog into this food by mixing it with your old dog food for a while. It may be on the rich side more so than some other dog food. My dog usually reacts that way when switching after a week or so is back regular. It seems to be just a bit more of a reaction with this food, but not severe.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Product good, shipping less than stellar!
customer_reviews.text: received shipment today, dog food seems to be OK but the box it was in was loaded with ants, had to take it back outside to take the contents out, was also very greasy inside the box, left greasy spots on my floor where the box touched the floor before I could get it back outside. this is a new product for my dog and she seems to like it, will try it again but caution on shipping. i would be very upset if box had been brought inside to sit until I got home to open. Ants would have been everywhere...thank you...
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: big poop- I guess dogs do not digest it well
customer_reviews.text: I am using this food for quite a few years now for my Labrador, and I was always happy until I tried new food. Using Rachel Ray food he pooped 5 times a day big, big poop, often waking us at night because he needed to go. I thought it is normal, but it is not. Now I use Hill's food and poops 2 times a day small poop (I am going to say 1/3 of the size of the other one) this is huge difference, he sleeps through the night and I am saving on poop bags;)
customer_reviews.author: Anna H.

customer_reviews.title: Way too much of a good thing
customer_reviews.text: There was nothing wrong with the product except that it was WAY TOO MUCH. I couldn't lift it. I wanted 6 [pounds of the dry dog food and you sent 28 pounds. There was no way I could send it back. So when m audiologist came by for a fitting of my hearing aids, I asked him for a suggestion about the dog food. He complied, so I DONATED it to a rescue place and he carried it off. I again ordered a small package, and am hoping for the best.-Harris, B..
customer_reviews.author: Clare

customer_reviews.title: Finally a dog food brand that we can consistently depend on!
customer_reviews.text: My 3.5 year old Labradoodle has a very fickle stomach and would have loose stool periodically throughout each month. We never can predict when or why, but it was always bound to happen at least a few days each month. We have big name, expensive brands, in the past but always the same. I love that this food doesn't have grains in it because I don't believe dog's were made to eat "rice." This is meat and vegetables and after 3 months being on this, my boy has had consistent solid stools and he is definitely less gassy as well. You also can't beat this price for a 40lb bag. Thank you, thank you, THANK YOU @ Rachael Ray
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Tomlin

customer_reviews.title: I only feed my dog and cats Rachael Ray Nutrish Natural Dry Foods.
customer_reviews.text: I only feed my dog and cats Rachael Ray Nutrish Natural Dry Foods. They are the cheapest of the foods that don't have all of the cancer causing additives and preservatives. And this food you can find at the grocery store, which is a plus. The cat variety I have only found online or at pet stores unless you're just buying a small bag, but hopefully one day they'll start carrying the big bags too. If you find this product review helpful, please click "yes" below!
customer_reviews.author: Stomkat

customer_reviews.title: Ask your vets before ordering!
customer_reviews.text: Way too expensive for how terrible for dogs this brand is. I speak to my vet regularly, especially when it comes to my senior dog and this brand is loaded with sodium. I had no idea that I had potentially been harming my dogs under the impression that this was healthier for them. I’ve order the beef flavor HUNDREDS of times over the years and I know I’ll never get my money back for the damage to my dogs health.
customer_reviews.author: Candice W.

customer_reviews.title: awesome dog food
customer_reviews.text: My dog seems to really like this brand dog food. Looking at the ingredients your meat and protein is at the top which is what you want in a dog food. They seem to really enjoy chicken and also the beef one. So far it's been our go to dog food now. Great value for the price as it's a lot more expensive in the stores then it is here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Robotica Industries

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this dog food!
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this brand of dog food for 18 months now, but noticed my last order was different packaging. Within 48 hours of eating this "new" food , my dog has been so so ill - explosive bloody diarrhea and vomiting. I thought it was something shed eaten off the street but its gotten so bad now I cant pinpoint it to anything but this food. After reading other reviews here, Im now certain. AVOID THIS BRAND IF YOU LOVE YOUR POOCH.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Very good food and love that I can subscribe and save each month
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs love this food. It is gluten free and very nutritional. Just need to remember if you have the one with beet root to not panic when your dogs look like they have blood on their bum after going potty. Since one of my dogs does have cancer and blood in her stool I can see the difference. Both my dogs are loving this food and I know it is so healthy for them. I'll keep buying this product. Thank you Rachel Ray for giving our 4 legged family awesome food.
customer_reviews.author: snorkie

customer_reviews.title: 8 Paws Up
customer_reviews.text: Had to switch because it became difficult to locate the Hills Science Diet I was giving my pups at a reasonable price. GLAD I did! My dogs almost couldn’t wait for me to open the bag. They have been on it for a week, still love it and no gastro issues.
customer_reviews.author: H.M.

customer_reviews.title: Healthy choice- worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: This is the only dog food my dog will eat and coincidentally also the healthiest for her. She is a senior, large dog who is predisposed to skin disorder. Since starting her on this food 4-5 years ago, no issue! I love the fact that I can order through amazon prime and have these heavy bags of food deliver straight to my front door!
customer_reviews.author: H Dorn

customer_reviews.title: If I could rate this lower I would: DO NO FEED TO PUGS
customer_reviews.text: A week after starting on this dog food my 1 year old male pug was diagnosed with acute pancreatitis. If I had continued to feed this to my dog my vet informed me it could have killed him. This is a healthy young dog. I'm so very lucky to have caught it before it had severe effects. I'm heartbroken to have bought something I thought was healthy for my dog and nearly killed him. I will not buy any more Rachel Ray products.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Kettledon

customer_reviews.title: Balance fiber and protein
customer_reviews.text: Greatly improved my dogs appetite and BMs. I mix it with rice or some sweet potato because now my dog can have up to three BM's per walk, not sure if this is excessive but he likes it. I do add a little water since he thinks everything that is dry is a treet and then wants to take it some where else in the house to eat it...lol. Good product so far and its been 3 months. He was coming off of a bland diet of chicken and white rice based on diarrhea concerns.
customer_reviews.author: D. McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Solid paws up rating from my border collie
customer_reviews.text: Piper the border collie gives this recipe a paws up rating. After checking the ingredient label (looking for grains like wheat and barley that dogs really don't need) I tried a small bag that I found at a local Walgreens. I quickly learned to keep some of that on hand as she would rather eat at work than at home with the expensive food I had there. So I looked around to find larger bags and ended up here.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Schlenger

customer_reviews.title: MOLDED FOOD!!!! 20lb bag. EWE ...
customer_reviews.text: MOLDED FOOD!!!! 20lb bag. EWE! I had previously used the 11 or 14lb bag. We didn't notice the mold. After they ate out of the 40lb bag, there was MOLD in their POOP! We will never buy Rachael Rays again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stale Food
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately all the bags of food were stale and my dogs wouldn’t eat it. The product itself is a good one. In fact it appears that my large breed dogs have become ill. I am today throwing out the last bag and a half. I am a very good Amazon customer but I do not think I should have to pay for this food. It smells oily and stale. So of course I tasted it. It’s stale.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy A.

customer_reviews.title: Possible bad batch
customer_reviews.text: I have been feeding my dog this for about a year with no problems. He liked it fine & always ate it. This new bag we got has been giving him & my other dog loose diarrhea. He sometimes refuses to eat it. As another reviewer stated, there must be a bad batch sent out recently.
customer_reviews.author: zaira hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Dog got sick
customer_reviews.text: They are owned buy smuckers now and they are on the watch list for cancer causing agents. This used to be all that we would feed our dogs but 1 recently passed from cancer. This food is bad. My other dog got violently sick from both ends from this. She loved the taste but her body rejected it. Just search recall and Rachael Ray dog food
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: The best brand of dog food on the market
customer_reviews.text: We've been using Rachel Ray Nutrish chicken for several years now. This is the only brand our dogs have not stopped eating. We have six dogs and they go through 40lbs once a week. We've tried Blue Buffalo, Taste of the Wild, Nutro, and several other national brands without long term success. We feed them once a day and eat when they want. They run a lot so weight gain is no issue.
customer_reviews.author: Phill

customer_reviews.title: Racheal Ray Nutrish Dog Food
customer_reviews.text: My labrador eats this chicken and pea Nutrish faithfully. She loves it. But not this bag. Something was wrong with it. She would lay on the floor and leave it in the dish. She never does this. Will only buy this from grocery store at least I know it's fresh. Sorry Amazon. She loves this stuff and still does.
customer_reviews.author: CuttersCorner

customer_reviews.title: Loyal Customer
customer_reviews.text: My dogs ❤️ This dog food. I change out the flavors to keep them interested. There is a decent choice of flavors making it easy to offer them the variety they like. I also like the ingredients. One of my dogs has food sensitivities and this product complies with his needs yet offers my other dogs the nutrition they need.
customer_reviews.author: Margo Giordano

customer_reviews.title: turned up his nose
customer_reviews.text: I bought it, my dog is the one who reacted to it and his reaction was.....I am not eating it. Even tried to dress it up with real meat. He ate the meat and left the dry food. So, I am hoping it may be a good plant food for my bushes and trees because that is about the only place the rest of the large bag of food can go.
customer_reviews.author: onepuka

customer_reviews.title: Our vet recommended we switch to Rachel ray after we adopted a ...
customer_reviews.text: Our vet recommended we switch to Rachel ray after we adopted a 6 year old great pyr who wasn’t eating much of other foods we tried. As soon as we poured this she ate the entire bowl of food! We are on our 3rd month with it and she gets so excited every time we get her food out! Happy dog and happy dog parents here.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rash causing?
customer_reviews.text: My dog developed an awful rash on her abdomen a few weeks after starting this food. The vet recommended changing her food and it immediately went away. After researching this brand more, I found out this isn’t an uncommon side effect. Every dog is different, but I wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra F

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and good price
customer_reviews.text: My dog has good allergies and started having seizures from cheap dog food with fillers. I switched to this and my dog hasn’t had any trouble at all. This food seems to be a good quality for an affordable price. When I first switched from cheap dog food I went to the most expensive brand names for natual dog food but realized I can find similar quality for much cheaper. Try this out, my dogs actually love the taste of it and again don’t have any allergy problems from fillers in the food!
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Pupper approved!
customer_reviews.text: I jumped on the high protein grain free band wagon until I noticed that my girls stopped having "solid deposits." I tried this brand based on other reviews. The girls are happy and going as expected. My young golden is maintaining her weight and my old doxy isn't gaining additional weight. They quite enough the flavor and have had no issues switching from pricey breed specific brands. Win all around! I noticed some gas from my 12 year old but nothing compared to the digestive distress experienced with food twice the cost. Worth a try.
customer_reviews.author: Sarika

customer_reviews.title: It may be good for some dogs
customer_reviews.text: Mixed with old food to transition, dogs got diarrhea. Never had that issue before. It may be good for some dogs, but not a fan of using this with mine.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Rachael’s dog food.
customer_reviews.text: Ranger loved this dog food but I may had ordered the wrong ingredients. The pellets was a dark color and we had always bought the light colored. I will go to the store and try to find the correct ingredients and get this straightened out. Otherwise this is best dog food.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Dog acting strange after eating
customer_reviews.text: Apparently this dog food taste well to my dog but after eating it he started acting very strangely.. like not wanting to come in the house which he normally does not do. he seemed confused because he would go in to the bathroom where he normally would not go because he thinks hes going to get a bath. About a week after we stopped giving it to him he was back to normal.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Cox

customer_reviews.title: Great quality dry food dog's staple dry food :)
customer_reviews.text: Food my pet dog, midlife aged and nearly 20 lbs sized still loves the most Has not out lost appetite for this food the entire time on the diet when mealtime is served. Loved by my active pet every meal for over a year ago. Pleased with my lifetime pet's continued dog food we will keep our pet as his main food brand and I am pleased how health is same as it had been when he was switched to it over a year ago. Worth my money every bag I buy again. Worth the time while choosing the mail food you will feed a majority of your pets diet meal needs. .
customer_reviews.author: Terry Miller

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Immediately gave all 3 of my dogs horrible diarrhea and stomach problems.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it. Great food! Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Best value in dog food that I can find. The dogs love this food. Bowls are cleaned thoroughly. I mix with wet food. Most other dry foods I’ve tried are not enjoyed as well as this food. The dogs usually dig past the dry food to get to the wet food. With this food they eat it all every time.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: It made my dogs hair fall out in clumps
customer_reviews.text: So, I am giving this 3 stars to be kind. I adopted a flat coat retriever and thought I would give this a try. I started to notice my dog shedding a lot. I thought it had to do more with summer....until I started seeing bald patches. His hair was literally falling out in clumps. I’m not sure what it is in the food that caused this reaction or if it was caused by a deficiency because of a lack of something in the diet but I was properly freaked out that I switched to a pet store food and vowed to never go the grocery store dog food route again.
customer_reviews.author: CPR611

customer_reviews.title: Great dog food!
customer_reviews.text: We used to use Iams and our 5year old pup didn’t seem to eat much, transitioned the both of our pups into this and it’s crazy the difference it makes with them! Our older dog eats well, and his energy levels are much better than ever and he’s so much happier. Great quality and affordable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy happy happy
customer_reviews.text: My dogs, a white boxer & a handsome Frenchie are SUPER sensitive. It’s been quite frustrating trying to find food that doesn’t bother their sensitive skin, digestive system, etc... Finally all of us are relieved 😌 by their comfort. Now they cannot wait to eat ☺️
customer_reviews.author: Stylinforu

customer_reviews.title: Upset my labs stomach, she ate grass and then throw up
customer_reviews.text: Made my lab sick , she eventually would not eat it.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn D. Vance

customer_reviews.title: Rachael Rays Nutrish Dry Dog Food is great for a fussy dog, quick delivery
customer_reviews.text: Awesome food for my fussy dog. Rachael Rays Nutrish Natural dog food, Chicken is healthy and my little dog looks forward to eating now. It took awhile to find the right combination to get my dog to enjoy her food. I mix Rachael arrays with wellness wet food and it works wonders. Quick delivery. I just added it to auto delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Lauri

customer_reviews.title: Yum-yum!  She loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My big old 60 lb Pitti loved it! Of course she’s a big piggy pitti who eats almost anything, but you could tell by how she scarfs it down. I don’t know much about quality of ingredients but I figured Rachel has a Pitt, she loves all animals, she’s an awesome chef,.....well, that’s enough for me!
customer_reviews.author: Lyna

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say enough good things about this food. I have a 12 year old mix and a 2 year old lab who love anything Rachel ray. I love this brand because it’s mads in the USA, contains ingredients I can’t actally understand unlike other brands and the price! It’s great to be able to feed both dogs the same food. I’ve never been able to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Great choice. My dogs shedding is lower and healthier using this.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this and it’s really good for his fur. I tried switching to kibble and bits just to see and he literally started shedding and losing hair. I can tell you there is a difference between this and the normal brands. It could be s tad cheaper but in all honesty it’s work it
customer_reviews.author: sharonda j.

customer_reviews.title: SOMETHING CHANGED.
customer_reviews.text: At first all was great. Then it happened. Poopnpukemageggedon. Not sure if the recipe changed, if a bad batch was released, or what. All 3 of my dogs got extremely sick. It was not because I bought it on Amazon. Never again. If it was my 80lbs dog Mordy who has IBS, then I would not have changed my post, but ALL 3 got sick, at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: LittleKrissy

customer_reviews.title: My Dog Approves
customer_reviews.text: Our dog has very sensitive skin and we’ve had a lot of trail and error with foods. Even the high dollar options left him itchy. This has been a great options for him and we have purged it multiple times now so I’m pretty sure he will continue to do well on it. His tummy doesn’t get upset, skin isnt itchy(unless his outdoor allergies get him) and his coat is nice and shiny. We had found that the “fillers” in many foods just left him not feeling his best.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We have both a Standard Poodle and an Moyen Poodle although they are not picky eaters they do not process preservatives well. We Love the Rachael Ray Nutrish dry foods. Within 5 days there systems seemed to process this food with no side affects. Happy dogs make a Happy life in our home. We have been using Rachael Ray products for about 2 years now. GG and Chloe Belle highly recommend the Rachael Ray products. One of the best dog foods ever that we have used.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made my dog sick
customer_reviews.text: My dog throws up every time he eats it. Read the reviews. Lots of people say their dogs also vomit from it.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Christenson

product_meta.title: Rachael Ray Nutrish Super Premium Dry Dog Food, Chicken & Veggies Recipe
product_meta.description: Size:28 Lb. BagYour dog deserves the absolute best — like quality dog food with simple ingredients and essential nutrients that you can trust. When average chicken dog food just doesn't cut it, serve your four-legged family member his or her very own version of a classic chicken and veggies meal. Rachael Ray Nutrish Premium Natural Dry Dog Food Real Chicken & Veggies Recipe is a delicious, dog-friendly take on a savory chicken and veggies dinner. This premium dry dog food recipe is made with simple, natural ingredients, like real U.S. farm-raised chicken, which is always the number one ingredient, combined with wholesome vegetables and added vitamins and minerals. U.S. farm-raised chicken provides high-quality protein to help support lean muscle, and the veggies add fiber to help support healthy digestion. It's a wholesome and satisfying way to show your dog you care while providing 100% complete and balanced nutrition. This premium dog food recipe is Rachael-approved, natural and contains no corn, wheat, soy, gluten, poultry by-products, fillers, artificial flavors or artificial preservatives. Better yet, a portion of your purchase will help support The Rachael Ray Foundation, which helps animals in need get the food, medical supplies, treatments, and more that they may need.
feature_bullets: Contains (1) 28 Pound Bag of Dry Dog Food
US farm-raised chicken is the 1 ingredient
No poultry by-product meal, filler, wheat, or wheat gluten ingredients
Natural dog food with added vitamins & minerals
Safely USA cooked with the world's best ingredients
